RockDetails: Granite is a coarse-grained igneous rock.
Marble is a metamorphic rock composed of.
Basalt is a fine-grained volcanic rock.
Slate is a fine-grained metamorphic rock.
Sandstone is a sedimentary rock composed of sand-sized grains.
Limestone is a sedimentary rock primarily composed of calcium carbonate.
Shale is a fine-grained sedimentary rock formed from mud.
Gneiss is a metamorphic rock characterized by banded appearance.
Quartzite is a metamorphic rock primarily composed of quartz.
Schist is a medium- to coarse-grained metamorphic rock.
Rhyolite is a volcanic rock with a high silica content.
Pumice is a light-colored, porous volcanic igneous rock.
Obsidian is a natural volcanic igneous rock commonly associated with the game Minecraft
Gabbro is a dark, coarse-grained plutonic rock.
Serpentine is a green, metamorphic rock.
Chalk is a soft, white, porous limestone rock.
